title: Terran Orbital still waiting for milestone Rivada Space constellation payment
summary: Terran Orbital chair and CEO Marc Bell said it is lowering 2023 revenue guidance following payment delays from Rivada Space, even though the satellite maker’s largest customer still expects to pay $180 million later this year under their $2.4 billion constellation contract.

title: NASA Safety Panel Issues Clarion Call for ISS Deorbit Tug
summary: NASA’s Aerospace Safety Advisory Panel made it crystal clear today that building a tug to deorbit the International Space station is “not optional,” budget constraints notwithstanding. The panel has been […]

title: UK helps fund Rocket Factory Augsburg’s maiden flight
summary: The UK Space Agency is providing £3.5 million ($4.3 million) to help Germany’s Rocket Factory Augsburg prepare for its maiden flight next year from SaxaVord Spaceport, located in Scotland’s Shetland Islands.

title: RFA UK Receives £3.5M for SaxaVord Development
summary:
Rocket Factory Ltd, the UK-based subsidiary of the German launch startup Rocket Factory Augsburg (RFA), has received £3.5 million in funding from the UK Space Agency and the European Space Agency to support its plans to launch from SaxaVord Spaceport in Scotland. The funding was awarded as part of the ESA Boost! programme, which aims […]
The post RFA UK Receives £3.5M for SaxaVord Development appeared first on European Spaceflight.

title: AFRL, Space Force to collaborate with Indian startups on space technologies
summary: The Air Force Research Laboratory announced new Cooperative Research and Development Agreements, or CRADAs, between the U.S. Space Force and two Indian startups.
